I'm trying to build this on my machine (Win8.1, both VS 2013 and VS 2015 are installed).

msbuild from command line looks like it's missing some build tools - I've tried installing MS build tools 2015 explicitly, but that didn't help.

```
     C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\Microsoft.Cpp\v4.0\V120\Microsoft.Cpp.Platform.targets(64,5): error MSB8020: Th
   e build tools for v140 (Platform Toolset = 'v140') cannot be found. To build using the v140 build tools, please
   install v140 build tools.  Alternatively, you may upgrade to the current Visual Studio tools by selecting the Pr
   oject menu or right-click the solution, and then selecting "Upgrade Solution...". [C:\incubator-reef\lang\cs\Org
   .Apache.REEF.Bridge\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge.vcxproj]
```

Build from VS 2015 (after Clean solution) fails with a bunch of errors like these

Severity    Code    Description Project File    Line
Error       Metadata file 'C:\incubator-reef\lang\cs\bin\x64\Debug\Org.Apache.REEF.IMRU\Org.Apache.REEF.IMRU.dll' could not be found    Org.Apache.REEF.IMRU.Examples   C:\incubator-reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.IMRU.Examples\CSC 
Error       Metadata file 'C:\incubator-reef\lang\cs\bin\x64\Debug\Org.Apache.REEF.IMRU.Examples\Org.Apache.REEF.IMRU.Examples.exe' could not be found  Org.Apache.REEF.IMRU.Tests  C:\incubator-reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.IMRU.Tests\CSC  
Error       Metadata file 'C:\incubator-reef\lang\cs\bin\x64\Debug\Org.Apache.REEF.Examples.AllHandlers\Org.Apache.REEF.Examples.AllHandlers.exe' could not be found    Org.Apache.REEF.Tests   C:\incubator-reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Tests\CSC 
Error       Metadata file 'C:\incubator-reef\lang\cs\bin\x64\Debug\Org.Apache.REEF.Client\Org.Apache.REEF.Client.dll' could not be found    Org.Apache.REEF.IMRU    C:\incubator-reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.IMRU\CSC  

Building individual projects fails without errors but with warnings like this

Severity    Code    Description Project File    Line
Warning     The primary reference "C:\incubator-reef\lang\cs\bin\x64\Debug\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge.exe" could not be resolved because it was built against the ".NETFramework,Version=v4.5.2" framework. This is a higher version than the currently targeted framework ".NETFramework,Version=v4.5". Org.Apache.REEF.Examples.AllHandlers  
Warning     The referenced project 'Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge' is targeting a higher framework version (4.5.2) than this project’s current target framework version (4.5). This may lead to build failures if types from assemblies outside this project’s target framework are used by any project in the dependency chain.   Org.Apache.REEF.Examples.AllHandlers        

Any suggestions on fixing these?
Those are exactly the kinds of issues I faced before it magically started working on one machine. So maybe it was a positive fluke?
The file `lang/cs/Org.Apache.REEF.Client/featfile.txt` doesn't seem to serve a purpose. I needed to delete it to make the build pass...
I just tried on a machine with both VS 2013 and 2015 and it failed as well. Will try again on my "clean" home machine tonight to see whether that makes a difference.

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #529](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/529/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good

As I mentioned on the JIRA: HelloREEF serves as (currently) the only clean example of how to use REEF.NET, and this change makes it more complex than needed. Having this here will make [REEF-745](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-745) harder. Wouldn't it be better to solve [REEF-751](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-751) instead of accumulating special cases in the example code?
Let's discuss over on JIRA whether we want to do this or not and then come back here.

I've tried building on my laptop with only VS 2015. Doesn't build either; `msbuild` from command line gives a bunch of 

```
   "C:\incubator-reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.sln" (default target) (1) ->
   "C:\incubator-reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Client\Org.Apache.REEF.Client.csproj" (default target) (15) ->
   "C:\incubator-reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge.vcxproj" (default target) (21:5) ->
     C:\incubator-reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge.vcxproj(44,3): error MSB4019: The impo
   rted project "C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\Microsoft.Cpp\v4.0\V110\Microsoft.Cpp.Default.props" was not found.
    Confirm that the path in the <Import> declaration is correct, and that the file exists on disk.
```

And the build from VS 2015 gives the same "Metadata file could not be found" errors, plus 

```
    Failed to locate: "CL.exe". The system cannot find the file specified.
```

Interesting. Maybe our `build.props` is to blame:

```
<Project InitialTargets="ExtractPOMVersion" ToolsVersion="12.0" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/developer/msbuild/2003">
```

We depend explicitly on version `12.0` of the tools. This might override what we set in the individual project files, which have lines like this one:

```
<Import Project="$(VCTargetsPath)\Microsoft.Cpp.targets" />
```

or this one:

```
<Import Project="$(MSBuildToolsPath)\Microsoft.CSharp.targets" />
```

I'll change it to 14.0 and see whether it helps.

I changed the version in build.props and rebased the changes onto current `master`.

@tcNickolas can you try again?

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #532](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/532/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good

In the last commit, I used the VS package manger to update all our dependencies to their newest stable version. Also, I updated one of the build files to directly refer to Avro, not via a variable to make the references resolve.

Good news: This now builds in VS 2015 and on the command line.

Bad News: This is unlikely to be our final solution, as it upgrades our dependencies which can get our users in trouble.

@tcNickolas Can you test this version? If it works for you, we can start downgrading dependencies to the changes we need to make it build.

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #534](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/534/) UNSTABLE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request

I'm looking closer at the results of the Findbugs, and there are a lot of bugs introduced by autogenerated ProtoBuf files:
- `...PARSER isn't final but should be` 
- `Useless control flow in ... $Builder.maybeForceBuilderInitialization()` 
- `Class ... defines non-transient non-serializable instance field ...`

We can't fix anything that is generated from .proto files, so I think we should exclude classes named `*.proto.*` to reduce number of bugs we're looking at. Let me update PR with this configuration
@tcNickolas Thanks. I would like to take a look at once you updated the PR.
This looks good. I will merge.
